result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda J Rivers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Hazardous Substance with the Intent to Abuse Hazardous Substance, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.316(2)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes: all financials placed on payment plan $30 per month. Defendant to file a financial disclosure statement with the court within 30 days
Restitution is joint and several with codefendant. Restitution to be paid to individuals first then insurance company
To seek, obtain and maintain full time employment.
Def to enroll in the Ashland County Adult Drug Court & complete successfully.
The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

Any contraband seized to be forfeited!
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail within 7 days (CORRECTED 7/11/16).
NO CONTACT WITH MICHAEL NEIBAUER
NO CONTACT with known drug users/dealers other than for the purposes of court or treatment.
  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..EXCEPT FOR EMPLOYMENT!
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

timeConds.notes:
60 days of jail time is imposed and 90 days is IMPOSED AND STAYED pending the defendant's successful completion of drug court. The parties further agree that the imposed and stayed time will be available for use as sanction time for any vioaltions of drug court rules by the defendant. 
Contact the Jail within 7 days to set up time to begin serving sentence.

9/26/17 Defendant has successfully completed Drug Court. 90 days of jail, which was originally stayed, is now VACATED.

Def can discharge from Probation as schd. any fin. obligations are a civil judgement- on the DEJ- Ct finds that the def completed that to the Statf. of the Vic. Grants the Def the compleation of the agreement. Count 6 is DRI.

Did not mean to not pay rest. Not on an income assingment. Does not trust employer to pay it. Works at Frankies. Got a new Job working back in health care. Working at the assited living homes as a care giver. Working 2 part time jobs. 
Term in DEJ agreement-- That needs to pay Rest. or engage int he process of paying Rest.
